==Events==
* [[364]] &ndash; Emperor [[Jovian (Emperor)|Jovian]] dies after a reign of eight months. He is found dead in his tent at [[Tyana]] ([[Asia Minor]]) en route back to [[Constantinople]] in suspicious circumstances.
*[[1370]] &ndash; [[Northern Crusades]]: [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]] and the [[Teutonic Knights]] meet in the [[Battle of Rudau]].
*[[1411]] &ndash; Following the successful campaigns during the [[Ottoman Interregnum]], [[Musa Çelebi]], one of the sons of [[Bayezid I]], becomes [[Sultan]] with the support of [[Mircea I of Wallachia]].
*[[1500]] &ndash; Duke [[Frederick I of Denmark|Friedrich]] and Duke [[John of Denmark|Johann]] attempt to subdue the [[peasant]]ry of [[Dithmarschen]], [[Denmark]], in the [[Battle of Hemmingstedt]].
*[[1600]] &ndash; The philosopher [[Giordano Bruno]] is burned alive, for [[Christian heresy|heresy]], at [[Campo de' Fiori]] in [[Rome]].
*[[1621]] &ndash; [[Myles Standish]] is appointed as first commander of [[Plymouth, Massachusetts|Plymouth colony]].
*[[1753]] &ndash; In [[Sweden]] February 17 is followed by [[March 1]] as the country moves from the [[Julian calendar]] to the [[Gregorian calendar]].
*[[1801]] &ndash; An [[U.S. Electoral College|electoral]] tie between [[Thomas Jefferson]] and [[Aaron Burr]] is resolved when Jefferson is elected [[President of the United States]] and Burr [[Vice President of the United States|Vice President]] by the [[United States House of Representatives]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[War of the Sixth Coalition]]: The [[Battle of Mormans]].
*[[1819]] &ndash; The United States House of Representatives passes the [[Missouri Compromise]] for the first time.
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Weenen massacre]]: Hundreds of [[Voortrekkers]] along the Blaukraans River, [[KwaZulu-Natal Province|Natal]] are killed by [[Zulu people|Zulu]]s.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom]] recognizes the independence of the [[Orange Free State]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; A group of citizens of [[Geneva]] founded an International Committee for Relief to the Wounded, which later became known as the [[ICRC|International Committee of the Red Cross]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The {{Ship||H. L. Hunley|submarine|6}} becomes the first [[submarine]] to [[Sinking of USS Housatonic|engage and sink a warship]], the {{USS|Housatonic|1861|6}}.
*[[1865]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Columbia, South Carolina]], is [[Capture of Columbia|burned]] as [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces flee from advancing [[United States|Union]] forces.
*[[1871]] &ndash; The victorious [[Prussia]]n Army parades through [[Paris, France]] after the end of the [[Siege of Paris (1870-1871)|Siege of Paris]] during the [[Franco-Prussian War]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; ''[[Madama Butterfly]]'' receives its première at [[La Scala]] in [[Milan]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; The [[Armory Show]] opens in [[New York City]], displaying works of artists who are to become some of the most influential painters of the early 20th century.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Blaine Act]] ends [[Prohibition in the United States]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Eniwetok Atoll]] begins. The battle ends in an American victory on [[February 22]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Operation Hailstone]] begins. U.S. naval air, surface, and submarine attack against [[Truk Lagoon]], Japan's main base in the central [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific]], in support of the [[Battle of Eniwetok Atoll|Eniwetok invasion]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Chaim Weizmann]] begins his term as the first [[President of Israel]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Project Vanguard]]: [[Vanguard 2]] &ndash; The first [[weather satellite]] is launched to measure [[cloud]]-cover distribution.
*[[1964]] &ndash; In ''[[Wesberry v. Sanders]]'' the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules that [[Congress of the United States|congressional]] districts have to be approximately equal in population.
*  1964   &ndash; Gabonese president [[Leon M'ba]] is toppled by [[1964 Gabon coup d'état|a coup]] and his rival, [[Jean-Hilaire Aubame]], is installed in his place.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Ranger program|Project Ranger]]: The [[Ranger 8]] probe launches on its mission to photograph the ''[[Mare Tranquillitatis]]'' region of the [[Moon]] in preparation for the manned [[Apollo program|Apollo]] missions. ''Mare Tranquillitatis'' or the "Sea of Tranquility" would become the site chosen for the [[Apollo 11]] lunar landing.
*[[1968]] &ndash; In [[Springfield, Massachusetts]], the [[James Naismith|Naismith]] Memorial [[Basketball Hall of Fame]] opens.
*[[1972]] &ndash; Sales of the [[Volkswagen Beetle]] exceed those of the [[Ford Model-T]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Robert K. Preston]], a disgruntled [[U.S. Army]] private, buzzes the [[White House]] in a stolen [[helicopter]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] detonates an [[incendiary bomb]] at the [[La Mon restaurant bombing|La Mon restaurant]], near Belfast, killing 12 and seriously injuring 30.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Sino-Vietnamese War]] begins.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Mount Everest]], 1st Winter Ascent by [[Krzysztof Wielicki]] and [[Leszek Cichy]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]]: [[Armenia]]n troops [[Garadaghly Massacre|massacre]] more than 20 [[Azerbaijani people|Azerbaijani]] civilians in the village of [[Qaradağlı, Khojavend|Qaradağlı]]
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Cenepa War]] between [[Peru]] and [[Ecuador]] ends on a [[cease-fire]] brokered by the [[United Nations|UN]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; In [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], world champion [[Garry Kasparov]] beats the [[IBM Deep Blue|Deep Blue]] [[supercomputer]] in a [[chess]] match.
*  1996   &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Discovery Program]] begins as the [[NEAR Shoemaker]] spacecraft lifts off on the first mission ever to orbit and land on an asteroid, [[433 Eros]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[London Congestion Charge]] scheme begins.
*[[2006]] &ndash; A [[2006 Southern Leyte mudslide|massive mudslide]] occurs in [[Southern Leyte]], [[Philippines]]; the official death toll is set at 1,126.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Kosovo]] [[2008 Kosovo declaration of independence|declares independence]] as the [[Republic of Kosovo]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[2011 Libyan civil war|Libyan protests]] begin. In [[Bahrain]], [[Special Security Force Command|security forces]] launched a deadly [[pre-dawn raid]] on protesters in [[Pearl Roundabout]] in [[Manama]], the day is locally known as [[Bloody Thursday (2011)|Bloody Thursday]].
